Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of San Francisco
Private Litigation Case Title: Aaron Martinez Vs. Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc.

Description: Take-Two Interactive agreed to pay $300,000 to the Manhattan District Attorney's Office as part of a settlement of allegations it had falsified business records concerning the issuance of stock options for executives, leading to compensation being fraudulently hidden from taxing authorities. The employees responsible pleaded guilty to criminal charges, the corporation was granted a settlement on the grounds its current management was uninvolved in the violations.  The company also paid a $3 million penalty to the SEC; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-take-two-interactive-software-inc
